p.s: The extract of Macbeth written by Shakespeare is about an argument between Macbeth and his wife.
They discuss if they really should kill the King or not.
Macbeth begins the argument by telling his wife that he won't kill the King for now.
His wife does not like his idea and tries to convince him by calling him a coward and saying that he has no courage.
Macbeth gets angry and tells her to stop.
He thinks that doing that is not a proper behaviour for a man.
But Lady Macbeth still tries to convince him.
She says that he could be more than a man and that he waited for so long to be right time.
She thinks that the time has come and he has to do it.
Slowly Macbeth trusts her but he is scared of failing.
His wife calms him down by telling him how exactly they will kill the King.
She wants the guards to get so drunk that they will be no problem for them.
At the end his wife convinced him to kill the kingKing.
